questions.text: A room equipped with a shower, bathtub or combination bath/shower is a _____.
Fixture connections that require the removal of an access panel for servicing are considered _____.

That part of the lowest piping of a drainage system that receives the discharge from soil, waste, and other drainage pipes inside the walls of the building and conveys it to a point 2 feet outside the building wall is a _____.
A vertical vent that is a continuation of the drain to which it connects is a _____.
A horizontal drain that is sized to provide free movement of air above the flow line of the drain is called a _____.
The length along the centerline of the pipe and fittings is the _____.
A device integrated within an air accumulator vessel that is designed to discharge a predetermined quantity of water to fixtures for flushing purposes is a(n) _____.
The combination of fittings that may be used to make an offset and is considered a vertical pipe are _____.
Water that is satisfactory for drinking, culinary and domestic purposes and that meets the requirements of the Authority Having Jurisdiction is referred to by this code as _____.
By code definition, a stack is always _____.
A vent that also serves as a drain is a(an) _____.
A pipe that makes an angle of not more than 45 degrees with the vertical is considered _____.
The vertical depth of a trap seal is measured from _____.

options.text: the crown weir to the top of the dip of the trap
the inlet of the trap to the bottom of the trap
the outlet of the trap to the bottom of the trap
the inlet of the trap to the outlet of the trap

questions.text: Select the word or term that fits the sketch
Select the word or term that fits the sketch
Select the word or term that fits the sketch
Select the word or term that fits the sketch
Select the word or term that fits the sketch
Select the word or term that fits the sketch

Select the word or term that fits the sketch
Select the word or term that fits the sketch
Select the word or term that fits the sketch
A mixing valve that senses outlet temperature and compensates for fluctuations in incoming hot or cold water temperature is a _____.
The restroom facilities in a private day care center are classified as public use.
The discharge from clinical sinks and conveyed to the building drain is defined as a waste pipe.
A combined building sewer is a _____.

options.text: combination of all sewer and drainage piping from inside and outside of a building
building sewer that conveys industrial waste and domestic sewage
building sewer that conveys both sewage and storm water
building drains that convey waste and storm water

questions.text: PEX is defined as _____.
The lowest portion of the inside of a horizontal pipe is called the _____.
The part of the horizontal piping of a drainage system that begins _____ feet downstream from the last mobile home site and conveys it to a public sewer is called a mobile home park sewer.
A device and system of piping that maintains a water seal in a remote trap is called a trap primer.
Static pressure is pressure existing without any flow.
A permanently installed mechanical device, other than an ejector, for removing sewage or liquid waste from a sump is called a sewage pump.
A standard that is an extensive compilation of provisions covering broad subject matter is the definition for _____.
The principal artery of the venting system to which branches may be connected is called the _____.
A joint obtained by the joining of metal parts with metallic mixtures or alloys that melt at a temperature up to and including 840° F is a _____.
The organization, office, or individual responsible for enforcing the requirements of a code or standard is the _____.
That portion of a drainage system that does not drain by gravity into the building sewer is known as a _____.
A pipe inside a building that conveys storm water from the roof to a storm drain, combined building sewer, or other approved point of disposal is called a(an) ______.
An outlet on a boiler to permit emptying or discharging of sediment is called a(an) _____.
A device designed to provide protection against hydraulic shock in the building water supply system is called a a _____.
A device installed in a drainage system to prevent reverse flow is a _____.
Any pressure less than that exerted by the atmosphere is a  _____.
A document, the main text of which contains only mandatory provisions using the word “shall” to indicate requirements, is best described as a _____.
Unsanitary and insanitary share the same meaning.
When a back flow prevention device does not bear a critical level marking, the part of the device that shall constitute the critical level is the _____.
A water heater is by definition an appliance for _____.

options.text: heating water to a maximum of 210°F
supplying steam for domestic and commercial purposes
heating water and equipped with a draft hood
supplying hot water to a maximum of 190°F

questions.text: The pipe or duct that connects a fuel-gas-burning water heater to a gas vent or chimney is a _____.

A water heater that is constructed and installed so that all air for combustion is derived directly from the outside atmosphere and all flue gases are discharged to the outside atmosphere is a(n) _____.
Type B vent is used for venting a listed or approved appliance equipped to burn _____.

The piping and equipment between the street gas main and the gas piping system inlet, which is installed by and is under the control and maintenance of the serving gas supplier, is listed in the code as _____.
Grounding electrodes are devices that establish an electrical connection to the _____.
SCFM means _____.
A valve that controls the gas or vacuum service to a particular area is a (an) _____.
The pipe from the source of supply to a building or structure is the _____.
The service valve serves _____.

options.text: vertical piping extending from a horizontal branch
horizontal piping extending from a riser to a station outlet or inlet
all piping downstream from the source

questions.text: The T rating limits the maximum temperature rise of _____ above its initial temperature through the penetration on the nonfire side.
The definition of gray water is _____.

options.text: untreated wastewater that has not come into contact with kitchen sink or dishwasher waste
untreated wastewater that has not come into contact with toilet waste
wastewater from bathtubs, showers, lavatories, clothes washers and laundry tubs
all of the above are requirements

questions.text: Reclaimed water systems are defined as follows: _____.
A device located at the bottom of the tank for the purpose of flushing water closets and similar fixtures is a _____.
Gray water is untreated wastewater that has not come into contact with waste from which one of the following?
A physical separation that may be a low inlet into the indirect waste receptor from the fixtures, appliances, or devices indirectly connected is the definition for an _____.
A pipe that makes an angIe of 45 degrees from the vertical is considered _____.
The definition for the word “stack” does not include _____.
A medical gas system whose failure can cause minor injury to patients is defined as Category _____.
Air supplied from cylinders, bulk containers or reconstructed from oxygen USP is defined as Medical _____.
